<small>Also see: **<big>[[H8563|תַּמְרוּר]]</big>**</small>

 II. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּמְרוּר‎</span>] **noun masculine** plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּמְרוּרִים‎</span> [[Jer.31.21|Jer 31:21]], doubtful word; sense, and \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צִיֻּנִים‎</span>, require meaning ***sign-posts*** (= <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תאמ‎</span> compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***sign-post***, √ <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> see <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***sign***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***stones*** (heaped up) as way-mark; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***shew, point out, give sign or signal***); — [[BDB#Gie|Gie]] rejects strange form, reading <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּמֹרִים‎</span> ***palm-trees***, as posts. — 1. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ת‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מרר‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּמְרוּק‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רִיק‎</span>-, see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מרק‎</span>. 1. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּמְרוּר‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מרר‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּן‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תנן‎</span>.
